title: Everytime I Try To Kill A Low Health Vlad

replies.body: I find myself feeling so bad for the little guy...

I know. = (
I found the full video on youtube, and didn't feel so bad after I saw that they gave the Raccoon more candy afterwards though.  

...But then I clicked another cute animal video in the recommended links and found out about the cute animal video industry is driving species to extinction... and how animal poachers tear out the teeth of the Slow Loris without anesthetic so that people can record the animals' reactions to being tortured (tickled)...
What is that stuff the raccoon had?

> [{quoted}](name=Brisingr25,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=E7ulNhhY,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-03-31T17:17:51.982+0000)
>
> What is that stuff the raccoon had?

It's Candy Floss
Or how we say it in 'Murica, cotton candy.
Prolly just some sugar or salt
I would think it wouldn't dissolve instantly though...
depending on how solid the block was, it could have simply fallen apart that fast rather than totally dissolving

Depends on what's in the water. If it was relatively pure (like a spring) or warm, yeah, salt and sugar can dissolve REALLY quickly, especially salt.

Not to say it's either for sure, but salt be crazy, yo.

cotton candy
i saw it on facebook
It's not dry ice as that would have caused the water to bubble and a lot of fog to be generated. It may have been nitrogen or something similar.

> [{quoted}](name=Embertine,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=E7ulNhhY,comment-id=00000002,timestamp=2016-03-31T17:51:20.713+0000)
>
> It's not dry ice as that would have caused the water to bubble and a lot of fog to be generated. It may have been nitrogen or something similar.

It can't be anything close to being nitrogen or anything of that sort, if it was then the whole face of that raccoon would be frozen/ the raccoon wouldn't even touch it. It's just like the human body, you wouldn't touch liquid nitrogen now would you?
I forgot how cold nitrogen has to be to become solid. Well in any case I don't know what it is the raccoon has. . . .or had.
Cotton candy? :v
We are all getting out of topic
it was a piece of cotton candy/fairy floss.
It's Cotton Candy designed for animals. Hence why it dissolves in water.
Apparently not designed for raccoons.
I'm very curious about that as well.

> [{quoted}](name=Brisingr25,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=E7ulNhhY,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-03-31T17:17:51.982+0000)
>
> What is that stuff the raccoon had?

I believe it was something called candy floss

> [{quoted}](name=Brisingr25,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=E7ulNhhY,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-03-31T17:17:51.982+0000)
>
> What is that stuff the raccoon had?

cotton candy? idk
It was Cotton Candy

I have seen chunks of snow do this. Living in Iowa, as children playing with snow is common. Especially since it was a stream and carried it away. The only reason I wouldn't think this is the white dissolving away as well...
probably cotton candy or candy floss
It was cotton candy
Cotton candy
it's cotton candy
http://mtv.mtvnimages.com/uri/mgid:file:http:shared:mtv.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2014/12/rocket3-1419776762.gif
I once killed a {{champion:8}} with an {{champion:2}} Q that I threw when he was in the puddle.  Killed him right as he reformed.  Best.  Feeling.  EVER.
I think what would make that more satisfying is that Vlad does a little chuckle after he unpools. And then promptly gets smacked in the face by an axe.
He was running, so it was in the back.  Also between his mid lane towers.
My grandfather apparently had a pet raccoon he liked giving sugar cubes to. The little guy would be thrilled and try to wash it in a creek, where the cube melted.
He had a farm and I believe that was how the connection was made.

I think it was cotton candy (in a block shape maybe?)

...It seems really light
Cue the sad music.
me trying to get to silver

Pool it off, bro.

Get it? Pool instead of walk?
...
I'm bad at jokes.
Poor lil' guy ;-; feelsbadman
It was cotton candy guys, in the gif
Aww, that's just really sad.
